Articles.Content:
Greetings! 

I have an issue with the Stores website and am a bit concerned about it due to the fact it's popping up a untrusted flag on Firefox.

FireFox says that it couldn't get a security certificate from the Stores website.

if i'm the only one getting this then it might just be me ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif) if not then i hope the community can flag this for Squad to look at because i don't want some hacker taking my info.

thanks again! ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

I don't see it on Firefox. I don't actually have a store account but I got as far as the checkout page without seeing it. Usually it complains long before you start entering data (it is on an https page)

Yes I've security warning at work too (custom IE 9.0). It's not from the forum, but from the top left picture which seems to come from the main site. 

But here at home, I don't have any security warning from Firefox.

I'm not getting any such security warning. The certificate I'm seeing is from GoDaddy, for kerbalspaceprogram.com and has a SHA-1 fingerprint of A4 58 CA 37 AE 86 4B 13 EE 79 87 11 FE 57 AD 6A 4A 89 96 7B. The server I'm connected to is IP 85.236.103.6 which belongs to panic5.panicsoftware.co.uk 

I'm curious to know what you are seeing.
judging by the answers it seems to be just a little qwerk on my side. thanks. i'll get one of the admins to lock or trash this thread.
